item.title: Backyard Play Systems Recalls Playsets with Wooden Roof Due to Entrapment Hazard (Recall Alert)
item.description: The wooden parts used to reinforce and create a decorative gable design on the wooden roof pose an entrapment hazard to children. Children can become trapped in the gap between the lower part of the roof structure and the bottom of the gable decoration.
item.dc:creator: kcoleman@cpsc.gov

item.title: Walmart Recalls Better Homes and Gardens Essential Oil Infused Aromatherapy Room Spray with Gemstones Due to Rare and Dangerous Bacteria; Two Deaths Investigated
item.description: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) has confirmed that bacteria in a recalled aromatherapy room spray in a Georgia melioidosis patientâ€™s home genetically matches the bacterial strains in the patient, and three other patients in Kansas, Minnesota, and Texas. The bacteria Burkholderia pseudomallei cause melioidosis, a condition that is difficult to diagnose and can be fatal.Â  The Georgia and Kansas patients died.
item.dc:creator: kcoleman@cpsc.gov

item.title: Magnussen Home Recalls Nova Series 5-Drawer Chests Due to Tip-Over and Entrapment Hazards
item.description: The recalled chests are unstable if they are not anchored to the wall, posing tip-over and entrapment hazards that can result in death or serious injuries to children. The chests do not comply with the performance requirements of the voluntary industry standard ASTM F2057-19.
item.dc:creator: TSanders@cpsc.gov

item.title: Luyuan Recalls Youth All-Terrain Vehicles (ATVs) Due to Crash Hazard and Violation of Federal ATV Safety Standard
item.description: The youth ATVs fail to comply with the requirements of the federal mandatory ATV safety standard, including maximum speed limitations and other mandatory safety requirements for vehicles intended for children under 10 years of age. ATVs that fail to meet the mandatory safety requirements pose a risk of serious injury or death to children.
item.dc:creator: kcoleman@cpsc.gov

item.title: The Boppy Company Recalls Over 3 Million Original Newborn Loungers, Boppy Preferred Newborn Loungers and Pottery Barn Kids Boppy Newborn Loungers After 8 Infant Deaths; Suffocation Risk
item.description: Infants can suffocate if they roll, move, or are placed on the lounger in a position that obstructs breathing, or roll off the lounger onto an external surface, such as an adult pillow or soft bedding that obstructs breathing.Â
item.dc:creator: kcoleman@cpsc.gov

item.title: Step2Â® Recalls StepUp Sidekick Learning Towersâ„¢ Due to Fall Hazard (Recall Alert)
item.description: The storage tray with cup holders and step can come loose from the tower, posing a fall hazard to the child.
item.dc:creator: kcoleman@cpsc.gov

item.title: SKE Outdoors Recalls Kids Bike Helmets Due to Risk of Head Injury
item.description: The bicycle helmets do not comply with the U.S. CPSC federal safety standard for bicycle helmets, posing a risk of head injury.
item.dc:creator: kcoleman@cpsc.gov

item.title: Ryan and Rose Recalls Childrenâ€™s Eating Utensils Due to Choking Hazard (Recall Alert)
item.description: The handle of the Cutie Spoovel utensil can break off releasing small parts, posing a choking hazard for young children.Â
item.dc:creator: kcoleman@cpsc.gov

item.title: Wee Gallery Recalls Wooden Tray Puzzles Due to Choking Hazard
item.description: The octopus and elephant puzzle pieces can break, posing a choking hazard to young children.Â Â
item.dc:creator: kcoleman@cpsc.gov

item.title: Infant Bath Seats Recalled Due to Drowning Hazard; Imported by Frieyss and Sold Exclusively on Amazon.com (Recall Alert)
item.description: The bath seats fail to meet the federal safety standard for infant bath seats, including requirements for stability and leg openings, and can tip over while in use, posing a drowning hazard to babies.
item.dc:creator: kcoleman@cpsc.gov

item.title: Nordstrom Recalls Childrenâ€™s Socks Due to Choking Hazard
item.description: The sockâ€™s pom pom can detach, posing a choking hazard to young children.
item.dc:creator: kcoleman@cpsc.gov

item.title: Hallmark Recalls Teethers Due to Choking Hazard
item.description: The finished wooden ring can break into small parts, posing a choking hazard
item.dc:creator: kcoleman@cpsc.gov

item.title: dormakaba Recalls Delayed Egress Locks Due to Risk of Entrapment in an Emergency
item.description: The lockset can fail to open, posing an entrapment hazard and inability to vacate a location in an emergency.
item.dc:creator: kcoleman@cpsc.gov

item.title: Childrenâ€™s Sleepwear Recalled Due to Violation of Federal Flammability Standard and Burn Hazard; Sold Exclusively by Zoetop Business Co. Ltd. at www.SHEIN.com (Recall Alert)
item.description: The recalled sleepwear sets fail to meet flammability standards for childrenâ€™s sleepwear, posing a risk of burn injuries to children.
item.dc:creator: kcoleman@cpsc.gov

item.title: Childrenâ€™s Pajamas Recalled Due to Violation of Federal Flammability Standard and Burn Hazard; Manufactured by Tkala Fashion; Sold Exclusively on Amazon.com
item.description: The pajamas fail to meet the federal flammability standards for childrenâ€™s sleepwear, posing a risk of burn injuries to children.
item.dc:creator: kcoleman@cpsc.gov

item.title: Birkenstock USA Recalls Kidsâ€™ Mogami Sandals Due to Choking Hazard
item.description: A plastic rivet can detach from the sandalâ€™s ankle strap, posing a choking hazard for young children.
item.dc:creator: kcoleman@cpsc.gov

item.title: Bel Furniture Recalls Barrington 5-Drawer Chests Due to Tip-Over and Entrapment Hazards; Sold Exclusively at Bel Furniture (Recall Alert)
item.description: The recalled chests are unstable if they are not anchored to the wall, posing tip-over and entrapment hazards that can result in death or serious injuries to children. The chests do not comply with the performance requirements of the voluntary industry standard ASTM F2057-14. Â
item.dc:creator: kcoleman@cpsc.gov

item.title: Walgreens Recalls Disney Baby Winnie the Pooh Rattle Sets Due to Choking Hazard
item.description: The feet on the Winnie the Pooh rattle can detach, posing a choking hazard to young children.
item.dc:creator: kcoleman@cpsc.gov

item.title: Canyon Furniture Recalls Creekside Childrenâ€™s Chests of Drawers Due to Tip-Over and Entrapment Hazards; Sold Exclusively at Rooms To Go (Recall Alert)
item.description: The recalled chests are unstable if they are not anchored to the wall, posing tip-over and entrapment hazards that can result in death or serious injuries to children. The chests do not comply with the performance requirements of the voluntary industry standard ASTM F2057-19. Â
item.dc:creator: kcoleman@cpsc.gov

item.title: One Twenty Clothing Company Recalls â€œSovereign Athleticâ€ Childrenâ€™s Robes Due to Violation of Federal Flammability Standard and Burn Hazard
item.description: The childrenâ€™s robes fail to meet the federal flammability standards for childrenâ€™s sleepwear, posing a risk of burn injuries to children.
item.dc:creator: kcoleman@cpsc.gov

item.title: Childrenâ€™s Robes Sold Exclusively on Amazon.com Recalled Due to Violation of Federal Flammability Standard and Burn Hazard; Manufactured by SIORO
item.description: The childrenâ€™s robes fail to meet the federal flammability standards for childrenâ€™s sleepwear, posing a risk of burn injuries to children. Â
item.dc:creator: TSanders@cpsc.gov

item.title: UPPAbaby Recalls Adapters Included with RumbleSeats Due to Child Fall Hazard
item.description: The adapters can detach, posing a fall hazard to the child in the RumbleSeat.
item.dc:creator: TSanders@cpsc.gov

item.title: Childrenâ€™s Nightgowns Sold Exclusively on Amazon.com Recalled Due to Violation of Federal Flammability Standard and Burn Hazard; Manufactured by Booph
item.description: The nightgowns fail to meet the federal flammability standards for childrenâ€™s sleepwear, posing a risk of burn injuries to children. Â
item.dc:creator: kcoleman@cpsc.gov

item.title: Childrenâ€™s Nightgowns Sold Exclusively on Amazon.com Recalled Due to Violation of Federal Flammability Standard and Burn Hazard; Manufactured by Auranso Official
item.description: The nightgowns fail to meet the federal flammability standards for childrenâ€™s sleepwear, posing a risk of burn injuries to children.
item.dc:creator: kcoleman@cpsc.gov

item.title: Blue Star Trading Recalls Childrenâ€™s Fishing Toy Games Due to Violation of Federal Lead Content Ban; Lead Poisoning Hazard; Sold Exclusively on Amazon.com (Recall Alert)
item.description: The metal rollers on the bottom of the flying dinosaur figures contain levels of lead that exceed the federal lead content ban. Lead is toxic if ingested by young children and can cause adverse health issues.
item.dc:creator: kcoleman@cpsc.gov

item.title: CamelBak Recalls Caps Sold with Podium and Peak Fitness Water Bottles Due to Choking Hazard
item.description: A small silicone valve in caps sold with the Podium and Peak Fitness water bottle can come loose and detach, posing a choking hazard.
item.dc:creator: kcoleman@cpsc.gov

item.title: Fisher-Price Recalls 4-in-1 Rock â€˜n Glide Soothers After Four Infant Deaths; 2-in-1 Soothe â€˜n Play Gliders Also Recalled
item.description: Infants who are placed unrestrained in the product and later found on their stomach are at risk of suffocation.
item.dc:creator: kcoleman@cpsc.gov

item.title: Ergobaby Recalls METROUS Strollers Due to Choking Hazard
item.description: The button on some buckles that release the harness can break and detach when pressed by the user while the child is in the stroller, making it difficult to release, and posing a choking hazard to young children.
item.dc:creator: TSanders@cpsc.gov

item.title: JCPenney Recalls Girls Puffer Jackets Due to Entanglement Hazard
item.description: The puffer jackets have a drawstring located inside the lining of the bottom area of the garment. Â The drawstring can become entangled or caught on playground slides, handrails, school bus doors or other moving objects, posing an entanglement hazard to children.
item.dc:creator: TSanders@cpsc.gov

item.title: K & M International Recalls Slap Watches Due to Coin Cell Battery Ingestion and Choking Hazards
item.description: The coin cell battery inside the slap watches can fall out, posing battery ingestion and choking hazards to young children.
item.dc:creator: kcoleman@cpsc.gov

item.title: Kolcraft Reannounces Recall of Inclined Sleeper Accessory and Urges Consumers to Act Now to Prevent Risk of Suffocation
item.description: Infant fatalities have been reported with other manufacturersâ€™ inclined sleep products, after the infants rolled from their back to their stomach or side, or under other circumstances.Â  Â
item.dc:creator: kcoleman@cpsc.gov

item.title: TJX Recalls Infant Sleep Bags Due to Suffocation Risk; Sold at T.J. Maxx, Marshalls and Sierra
item.description: The size of the neck opening is too large for infants 0 to 6 months, which can allow an infantâ€™s head to slip into and be covered by the sleep bag, posing a risk of suffocation.
item.dc:creator: kcoleman@cpsc.gov

item.title: BRAV USA Recalls Youth Jackets with Drawstrings Due to Strangulation and Entrapment Hazards
item.description: The recalled jackets have a drawstring in the hood and a drawsting in the waist area that can become entangled or caught on playground slides, hand rails, school bus doors or other moving objects, posing a strangulation and/or an entrapment hazard to children.
item.dc:creator: kcoleman@cpsc.gov

item.title: Battat Recalls Infant Teethers Due to Choking Hazard; Sold Exclusively at Target
item.description: The plastic wings can detach from the body of the teether, posing a choking hazard to young children.
item.dc:creator: kcoleman@cpsc.gov

item.title: Target Recalls Cat & Jack Baby Rompers Due to Choking Hazard
item.description: The heart-shaped graphics located on the knees of the romper can peel off or detach, posing a choking hazard to children.
item.dc:creator: kcoleman@cpsc.gov

item.title: Playgro Recalls Infant Activity Rattles Due to Choking Hazard
item.description: The abacus ring on the horses back can dislodge and release the small beads, posing a choking hazard to small children.
item.dc:creator: kcoleman@cpsc.gov

item.title: RH Recalls Childrenâ€™s Bath Wraps Due to Violation of Federal Flammability Standard
item.description: The recalled bath wraps fail to meet flammability standards for childrenâ€™s sleepwear, posing a risk of burn injuries to children.
item.dc:creator: kcoleman@cpsc.gov

item.title: Infant Bath Seats Recalled Due to Drowning Hazard; Imported by BATTOP; Sold Exclusively on Amazon.com (Recall Alert)
item.description: The bath seats fail to meet the federal safety standard for infant bath seats, including requirements for stability, and can tip over while in use, posing a drowning hazard to babies.
item.dc:creator: kcoleman@cpsc.gov

item.title: Genentech Recalls Prescription Drug Evrysdi Due to Failure to Meet Child Resistant Packaging Requirements; Risk of Drug Exposure through Eye or Skin Absorption (Recall Alert)
item.description: The bottles containing the prescription drug can leak due to a fit issue between the press-in bottle adapter and bottleneck. Â If the bottle is leaking, there is a risk of drug exposure by contact with skin or eyes. Â Prescription drugs must be in child resistant packaging that prevents children from gaining access to the contents as required by the Poison Prevention Packaging Act (PPPA).
item.dc:creator: kcoleman@cpsc.gov

item.title: SmartPool Recalls Childrenâ€™s Multi-Purpose Helmets Due to Risk of Head Injury
item.description: The recalled helmets were incorrectly advertised and marketed for children aged 2 years or older. Â However, the recalled helmets do not comply with minimum safety requirements for children younger than 5 and pose a risk of head injury to those children.
item.dc:creator: kcoleman@cpsc.gov

item.title: Anker Play Products Recalls 10-in-1 Incredible Inventions Science Kit Due to Violation of the Federal Lead Paint Ban
item.description: Paint on the red and blue magnet contains levels of lead that exceed the federal lead paint ban.Â  Lead is toxic if ingested by young children and can cause adverse health issues. Â In addition, the product packaging lacks the required warning labels for magnets and balloons.
item.dc:creator: kcoleman@cpsc.gov

item.title: CB2 Recalls Junction Tall Chests and Low Dressers Due to Tip-Over and Entrapment Hazards
item.description: The recalled chests and dressers are unstable if they are not anchored to the wall, posing serious tip-over and entrapment hazards that can result in death or injuries to children.Â
item.dc:creator: kcoleman@cpsc.gov

item.title: Juratoys Recalls Toy Trumpets Due to Choking Hazard
item.description: The small plastic pieces inside the toy trumpets can come loose and can be ingested by children, posing a choking hazard.
item.dc:creator: kcoleman@cpsc.gov

item.title: Noble House Home Furnishings Recalls Chests, Cabinets and Dressers Due to Tip-Over and Entrapment Hazards (Recall Alert)
item.description: The recalled chests, cabinets and dressers are unstable and can tip over if not anchored to the wall, posing serious tip-over and entrapment hazards that can result in death or injuries to children. Â The chests do not comply with the performance requirements of the U.S. voluntary industry standard (ASTM F2057-19).
item.dc:creator: TSanders@cpsc.gov

item.title: John Deere Recalls Frontier Rotary Tillers Due to Injury Hazard (Recall Alert)
item.description: Some PTO drivelines were assembled without a specified safety sign.Â  The safety sign explains the associated hazards and that an operator or bystander can become entangled if there is contact with the driveline.
item.dc:creator: TSanders@cpsc.gov

item.title: Target Recalls Infant Rompers Due to Choking Hazard
item.description: Â The snaps can break or detach from the rompers, posing a choking, laceration and pinching hazards to children.
item.dc:creator: TSanders@cpsc.gov

item.title: Target Recalls Infant-Toddler Girlâ€™s One-Piece Rashguard Swimsuits Due to Choking Hazard
item.description: The snaps can break or detach from the suits, posing choking and laceration hazards to children.
item.dc:creator: TSanders@cpsc.gov

item.title: GSK Consumer Health Recalls Five Excedrin Brands Due to Failure to Meet Child Resistant Packaging Requirement; Risk of Poisoning
item.description: Some of the bottles containing the over-the-counter drug can have a hole in the bottom.Â  If there is a hole, children could access and swallow the contents, posing a risk of poisoning.Â  These products contain the substances aspirin and acetaminophen which must be in child resistant packaging as required by the Poison Prevention Packaging Act (PPPA).
item.dc:creator: kcoleman@cpsc.gov

item.title:
Homfa Cabinets Recalled Due to Tip-Over and Entrapment
Hazards; Made by Shenzhen Luosi Ge Trading Co. (Recall Alert)
item.description: The recalled cabinets are unstable if not anchored to the wall, posing tip-over and entrapment hazards that can result in death or serious injuries to children.Â  The cabinets do not comply with the performance requirements of the U.S. voluntary industry standard (ASTM F2057-19).
item.dc:creator: kcoleman@cpsc.gov
